intro: Litobrochia setifera, commonly known as the slender sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in marine environments. It belongs to the family Anisophylleidae and is characterized by its elongated, soft body covered in a layer of mucus. The animal has a distinctive appearance with a long, thread-like tail and a body that is often pale in color. It is primarily herbivorous, feeding on algae and other plant matter found in its habitat. Litobrochia setifera plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the breakdown of organic material and serving as prey for various marine predators.
